englishTranslationText: And	when	the	stars	fall	down.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	tāre	jhard	padeñ.

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	oceans	are	swept	away.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	samundar	bahā	diye	jāyeñ

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	graves	are	overturned.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	qabreñ	kuredi	jayeñ

englishTranslationText:
Every	soul	will	come	to	know	what	it	has	
sent	ahead	and	what	it	left	behind.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Har	Jān	jaan	le	gi	jo	us	ne	āge	bhejā	aur	jo	
peeche

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلْكَرِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
O	man!	What	has	deceived	you	away	from	
your	Lord,	the	Most	Beneficent?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	āadmi	Tujhe	kis	cheez	ne	fareb	diyā	
apne	karam	wāle	Rab	se

englishTranslationText:
The	One	Who	created	you,	then	moulded	
you,	then	made	you	proper?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	ne	tujhe	paidā	kiyā	phir	theek	banāyā	
phir	hamwār	farmāyā

arabicText: فِىٓ أَىِّ صُورَةٍۢ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ
englishTranslationText:
He	moulded	you	into	whatever	shape	He	
willed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	soorat	meiñ	chāhā	tujhe	tarkeeb	diyā

englishTranslationText:
Not	at	all	–	but	rather	you	deny	the	
establishment	of	Justice.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Koyi	nahiñ	balke	tum	insāf	hone	ko	
jhutlāte	ho

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	there	are	some	guardians	over	
you.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	tum	par	kuch	nigehbān	haiñ

englishTranslationText: The	honourable	recorders.
romanUrduTranslationText: Mu’azzaz	likhne	wāle

englishTranslationText: Knowing	all	what	you	may	do.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	jānte	haiñ	jo	kuch	tum	karo

englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	virtuous	are	in	serenity.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	nekokār	zaroor	chain	meiñ	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	the	sinners	are	in	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	badkār	zaroor	dozakh	meiñ	
haiñ

englishTranslationText: They	will	enter	it	on	the	Day	of	Justice.
romanUrduTranslationText: Insāf	ke	din	us	meiñ	jāyeñge.

englishTranslationText: And	will	not	be	able	to	hide	from	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	se	kahiñ	chup	na	sakeñge.

englishTranslationText:
And	what	do	you	know	–	of	what	sort	is	the	
Day	of	Justice!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	to	kyā	jāne	kaisā	insāf	kā	din?

arabicText: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدْرَىٰكَ مَا يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
englishTranslationText: Again,	what	do	you	know	–	of	what	sort	is	the	Day	of	Justice!
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	to	kyā	jāne	kaisā	insāf	kā	din?

arabicText: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌۭ لِّنَفْسٍۢ شَيْـًۭٔا ۖ وَٱلْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ لِّلَّهِ
englishTranslationText:
The	day	on	which	no	soul	will	have	the	authority	over	any	other	soul;	and	on	that	day,	the	entire	
command	belongs	to	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	koyi	jān	kisi	jān	ka	kuch	ikhtiyār	na	rakhegi	aur	sārā	ḥukm	us	din	Allāh	kā	hai.

englishTranslationText: Ruin	is	for	the	defrauders.	(Those	who	measure	less.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Kam	tolne	wāloñ	ki	kharābi	hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
englishTranslationText: Those	who	when	they	take	the	measure	from	others,	take	it	in	full!
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	ke	jab	auroñ	se	māp	(nāp	kar)	leñ	poorā	leñ.

englishTranslationText: Whereas	when	they	give	others	after	measuring	or	weighing,	they	give	them	less!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	unheñ	māp	yā	tol	kar	deñ	kam	kar	deñ.

englishTranslationText: What!	Do	they	not	expect	that	they	will	be	raised?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	un	logoñ	ko	gumān	nahiñ	ke	unheñ	uthnā	hai.

englishTranslationText: (To	be	raised)	for	a	Great	Day?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aik	‘azmat	wāle	din	ke	liye

englishTranslationText: The	day	when	everyone	will	stand	before	the	Lord	Of	The	Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	sab	log	Rabb-ul-Ālameen	ke	ḥuzoor	khade	hoñge.

arabicText: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed,	the	record	of	the	disbelievers	is	in	
the	lowest	place,	the	Sijjeen.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	kāfiroñ	ki	likhat	sab	se	neechi	
jagah	sijjeen	meiñ	hai

englishTranslationText:
And	what	do	you	know,	how	(wretched)	
the	Sijjeen	is!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tu	kyā	jāne	sijjeen	kaisi	hai

englishTranslationText: The	record	is	a	sealed	text.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	likhat	aik	mohar	kiyā	nawishta	
(teḥreer	nāma)	hai

englishTranslationText: Ruin	is	for	the	deniers	on	that	day!
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	jhutlāne	wāloñ	ki	kharābi	hai.

englishTranslationText: Those	who	deny	the	Day	of	Justice.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	insāf	ke	din	ko	jhutlāte	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	none	will	deny	it,	except	every	
transgressor,	rebel.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	isey	na	jhutlāyegā	magar	har	sarkash	
gunahgār

arabicText: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
When	you	recite	Our	verses	to	him,	he	says,	
“Stories	of	earlier	men!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	us	par	hamāri	Āyateñ	padhi	jāyeñ	kahe	
agloñ	ki	kahāniyāñ	haiñ

arabicText: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Not	at	all	–	but	rather	their	earnings	have	
heaped	rust	upon	their	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Koyi	nahiñ	balke	un	ke	diloñ	par	zang	
chadhā	diyā	hai	un	ki	kamāiyoñ	ne

arabicText: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Yes	indeed	–	they	will	be	deprived	of	
seeing	their	Lord	on	that	day.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hāñ	hāñ	be-shak	woh	us	din	apne	Rab	ke	
dieedār	se	maḥroom	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Then	indeed	they	have	to	enter	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	be-shak	unheñ	Jahannam	meiñ	dākhil	
honā

arabicText: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	will	then	be	said,	“This	is	what	you	used	
to	deny.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	kahā	jāye	gā	ye	hai	woh	jise	tum	
jhutlāte	the

arabicText: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	the	record	of	the	virtuous	is	in	the	
highest	place,	the	Illiyin.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hāñ	hāñ	be-shak	nekoñ	ki	likhat	sab	se	
ooñche	maḥal	‘illiyyeen	meiñ	hai

englishTranslationText:
And	what	do	you	know	what	the	Illiyoon	
are!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tu	kyā	jāne	‘illiyyeen	kaisi	hai

englishTranslationText: The	record	is	a	sealed	text.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	likhat	aik	mohar	kiyā	nawishta	
(teḥreer	nāma)	hai

englishTranslationText: Which	is	witnessed	by	the	close	ones.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	muqarrab	jis	ki	ziyārat	karte	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	virtuous	are	in	serenity.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	nekokār	zaroor	chain	meiñ	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: On	thrones,	watching.
romanUrduTranslationText: Takhtoñ	par	dekhte	haiñ

englishTranslationText: You	will	recognise	the	freshness	of	serenity	on	their	faces.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	un	ke	chehroñ	meiñ	chain	ki	tāzgi	pahchāne

englishTranslationText: They	will	be	given	pure	wine	to	drink,	which	is	kept	preserved,	sealed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Nithri	(khālis	wa	pāk)	sharāb	pilāye	jāyeñ	ge	jo	mohar	ki	huyi	rakhi	hai

arabicText: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌۭ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ
englishTranslationText: Its	seal	is	upon	musk;	and	for	this	should	those	who	crave	be	eager.
romanUrduTranslationText: Uski	mohar	mushk	par	hai	aur	isi	par	chāhiye	ke	lalchāyeñ	lalchāne	wāle

englishTranslationText: And	it	is	mixed	with	Tasneem.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	ki	milauni	(milāwat)	tasneem	se	hai

englishTranslationText: The	spring	from	which	drink	the	ones	close	to	Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	chashma	jis	se	muqarrabān-e-bārgāh	peete	haiñ

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	guilty	used	to	laugh	at	the	believers
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	mujrim	log	Imān	wāloñ	se	hañsā	karte	the.

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	believers	used	to	pass	by,	they	used	to	gesture	at	each	other	with	their	eyes.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	woh	in	par	guzarte	to	ye	āpas	meiñ	un	par	āñkhoñ	se	ishāre	karte

arabicText: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	whilst	returning	to	their	homes,	they	used	to	return	rejoicing.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	apne	ghar	palat-te	khushiyāñ	karte	palat-te

arabicText: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
englishTranslationText: And	upon	seeing	the	Muslims,	they	used	to	say,	“Indeed	they	have	gone	astray.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	Musalmānoñ	ko	dekhte	kahte	be-shak	ye	log	bahke	huye	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Whereas	they	have	not	at	all	been	sent	as	guardians	over	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ye	kuch	un	par	nigehbān	banā	kar	na	bheje	gaye

arabicText: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
englishTranslationText: So	this	day	it	is	the	believers	who	laugh	at	the	disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	āj	Imān	wāle	kāfiroñ	se	hañste	haiñ

englishTranslationText: On	high	thrones,	watching.
romanUrduTranslationText: Takhtoñ	par	baithe	dekhte	haiñ

arabicText: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	not	the	disbelievers	get	repaid	for	
what	they	used	to	do?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyuñ	kuch	badla	milā	kāfiroñ	ko	apne	kiye	
kā

englishTranslationText: When	the	heaven	breaks	apart.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	āsmān	shaq	ho

englishTranslationText:
And	it	listens	to	the	command	of	its	Lord	-	
and	that	befits	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apne	Rab	kā	ḥukm	sune	aur	usey	
sazāwār	hi	ye	hai.

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	earth	is	spread	out.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	zameen	darāz	ki	jāye

englishTranslationText:
And	it	unburdens	itself	of	all	that	is	in	it,	
and	becomes	empty.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	kuch	us	meiñ	hai	dāl	de	aur	khāli	ho	
jāye.

englishTranslationText:
And	it	listens	to	the	command	of	its	Lord	-	
and	that	befits	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apne	Rab	kā	ḥukm	sune	aur	usey	
sazāwār	hi	ye	hai

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًۭا فَمُلَـٰقِيهِ
englishTranslationText:
O	man,	indeed	you	have	to	surely	run	
towards	your	Lord,	and	to	meet	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	āadmi	Be-shak	tujhe	apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	
yaqeeni	daudnā	hai	phir	us	se	milnā

englishTranslationText:
So	whoever	is	given	his	record	of	deeds	in	
his	right	hand	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	woh	jo	apnā	Nāma-e-A’amāl	dahne	hāth	
meiñ	diyā	jāye

englishTranslationText:
Soon	an	easy	account	will	be	taken	from	
him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	se	‘an-qarib	sahel	ḥisāb	liyā	jāye	gā

englishTranslationText: And	he	will	return	to	his	family	rejoicing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	apne	ghar	wāloñ	ki	ṭaraf	shad	shad	
palte	gā

arabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهْرِهِۦ
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	is	given	his	record	of	deeds	
behind	his	back	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jis	kā	Nāma-e-A’amāl	us	ki	peeth	
ke	piche	diyā	jāye

englishTranslationText: Soon	he	will	pray	for	death.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	‘an-qarib	maut	mañgegā

englishTranslationText: And	will	go	into	the	blazing	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	bhadakti	āag	meiñ	jāyegā.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	he	used	to	rejoice	in	his	home.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	woh	apne	ghar	meiñ	khush	thā

englishTranslationText: He	assumed	that	he	does	not	have	to	return.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	samjhā	ke	usey	phirna	nahiñ

arabicText: بَلَىٰٓ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText: Surely	yes,	why	not?	Indeed	his	Lord	is	seeing	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	kyuñ	nahiñ	be-shak	us	kā	Rab	usey	dekh	rahā	hai.

englishTranslationText: So	by	oath	of	the	late	evening’s	light.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	mujhe	qasam	hai	sham	ke	ujāle	ki

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	night	and	all	that	gathers	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	ki	aur	jo	cheezeiñ	us	meiñ	jam’a	hoti	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	moon	when	it	is	full.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	chāñd	ki	jab	poorā	ho

englishTranslationText: You	will	surely	go	up	level	by	level.
romanUrduTranslationText: Zaroor	tum	manzil	ba	manzil	chardho	ge

englishTranslationText: What	is	the	matter	with	them	that	they	do	not	accept	faith?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	huā	Imān	nahiñ	late

arabicText: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ ۩
englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	Qur’an	is	recited	to	them,	they	do	not	fall	prostrate?		
(Command	of	Prostration	#	13)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Qur’ān	pardhā	jāye	Sajda	nahiñ	karte	
(Sajde	ka	hukm	#	13)

englishTranslationText: In	fact	the	disbelievers	keep	denying.
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	kāfir	jhutlā	rahe	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	Allah	well	knows	what	they	conceal	in	their	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Allāh	khob	jāntā	hai	jo	apne	ji	meiñ	rakhte	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Therefore	give	them	the	glad	tidings	of	a	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	tum	unheñ	dard-nāk	‘ažāb		ki	bishārat	do

arabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍۭ
englishTranslationText: Except	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds	-	for	them	is	a	reward	that	will	never	end.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	un	ke	liye	woh	sawāb	hai	jo	kabhi	khatm	na	hogā.

englishTranslationText:
By	oath	of	the	heaven	which	contains	the	
constellations.
romanUrduTranslationText: Qasam	āsmān	ki	jis	meiñ	burj	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	Promised	Day.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	din	ki	jis	kā	w’ada	hai	aur	us	din	ki	
jo	gawāh	hai
